Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: Pauline C
Reviews.Content: Myself and some colleagues recently spent a weekend in Barcelona with the Husa Oriente as our base. It is in a brilliant location right on Las Ramblas and the hotel itself was lovely. However it was the staff who made the stay excellent. Everyone at reception and in the breakfast room were so lovely and beyond helpful. I have travelled quite a lot and nowhere have I found reception staff more pleasant, helpful and generally a joy to speak to every day. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: laney142
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the 5th April 2012, a good base to see the tourist attractions, rooms were basic but clean only thing missing was tea/coffee facilities. Never had breakfast here as there is so much choice elsewhere! Barcelona was very busy walking along las ramblas felt like walking in treacle it was so slow! am glad i didn't go in the summer could only imagine how busy it must get! The hotel was ok, you certainly are only in the hotel to sleep as you are too busy during the day seeing all the tourist attractions! Went to patagonia bar for drinks it was really cheap 3 euros for a glass of cava and a shot and the staff were really friendly and the food was good and cheap too!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Hagai S
Reviews.Content: Right on La Ramblas. In the midst of action. A good starting point to any attraction in Barcelona. Great location. Basic but good value for a three star hotel. Very friendly staff. Decent breakfast. Very clean rooms. Ask for a room facing the back if you can't tolerate noise. Lots of it all along the night from la ramblas..people having fun down the street. Free internet. The aircondition didn't work well, but we were on a good season, so we jus't shut it off.

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: Colin F
Reviews.Content: Whilst being in an excellent location at the mid point along the Ramblas with clean but basic rooms and very helpful staff we are not clear on what basis the Husa Oriente is judged to be a 3* hotel. Apart from the possibility of breakfast and free wi-fi the hotel offers no guest facilities whatsoever: no coffee/tea facilities in the room, no room service, no fridge, no guest lounge (apart from a few seats on the lobby) and no bar. Arguably, since it is so close to the action, some of these things could be considered not so important but they are charging three star prices and since, unfortunately, it poured with rain every day during our stay it would have been good to have a place within the hotel for our party to meet together without the need to venture out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarknJayne
Reviews.Content: Dont let the rather grotty exterior put you off, immaculate inside, very clean and we were warmly greeted by friendly staff. Nothing was too much for them during our stay. The room was functional with a safe although our view of a brick wall was disappointing - but the chances are that you wont get a wonderful view when staying in a city centre hotel. Breakfast very good in spacious room with glass pyramid roof. We found it be an excellent location - on Las Ramblas and just a few minutes walk from a metro station, the waterfront and the Palau Guell is just around the corner. Would recommend the Royal Square which is just across from the road which has excellent restaurants and a very good Flamenco club.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value to the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Aviramk1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the weekend of the 16th , had agreat time , wonderful staff ! Breakfest was good just what u need. The location couldent have been better near evreything , port ti the south and plaza catalunya to the north , just great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: tonyjgreen
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location on La Rambla, about five minutes walk from the Columbus Monument overlooking the waterfront. Clean sheets, clean bathroom, comfortable bed. Friendly competent and helpful staff. Low cost for rooms. Negatives: Aircon in one room did not appear to work. Walls are a little thin, so noisy neighbours can disturb. Pillows were a little hard, and we asked for a second pillow each. Reception area is faded. (And if you want the latest marble finishes go pay at least three times the price elsewhere.) Preferring to sample the local atmosphere we ate out, including breakfast, but one round of drinks at the hotel's La Rambla cafe cost €40 for two large beers, one sangria and a water. Some rooms face inwards and should be quiet (they overlook the glass-roofed restaurant). We had a room on the third floor facing a brick wall. Not the best of views, but it was private and quiet. La Rambla is an area that attracts pickpockets, and we saw some of them, so sensible precautions are needed, but we never felt threatened. We also saw a lot of police who appear to be on top of the problem. The main irritant are the hawkers who come out at night, and 'entertainers' who offer gratuitous songs in the Placa Reial and then expect tips. The ability of one dreadlocked minstrel to remember the words and strum the correct tune did not match his ego. We ate most of our dinners in the Placa Reial, opposite the hotel across La Rambla. There are probably ten restaurants to choose from. Breakfasts were good value at Forns Del Pi on Carrer de Ferran, also across La Rambla about two/three minutes from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaretCambs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of La Rambla and as such is good value for money. I can't understand some of the poor reviews. The hotel staff were all always pleasant, The room was spotlessly clean and our room (422) at the back was very quiet. When we arrived the safe didn't work. It was fixed immediately. After the first night we asked for 2 extra pillows and received them. Yes, the rooms are fairly plain but when you are in Barcelona you hardly spend any tilme in the hotel. Wifi was available and free. Having just stayed at the hotel I feel that some of the 'reviewers' have never stayed there. On the other hand 'Miguel Barcelona' should be removed. A bit obvious!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful house keepers. i'll come back”
Reviews.Author: Miguel S
Reviews.Content: everything was great, good location with excellent people there. Close to the beach and every tourist place of interest

Reviews.Title: “The sun shone for us”
Reviews.Author: simon s
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here 2 teenagers and 2 ex teenagers, Its right In the center of town, next to the Fruit market ops a lovely traffic free square, Bars cafes all around you, The hotel is clean, bathroom and shower fine, breako was plentifull, No one stopped us going back and filling up on breads and fruit, But the real difrence to us is the staff, they couldnt help us enough, we even left are bags in a safe room on the last day as we had a 7.30pm flight to catch, we where able to wonder bag free,

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hjam_81
Reviews.Content: Obviously staying on La Rambla is as touristy as you can get in Barcelona but Husa Oriente is no way a bad place to stay. The rooms are large and clean, although with a bit of a outdated feel to them. The staff is friendly and the breakfast satisfactory. But all in all it's probably a good idea to check hotels a bit futrther away from La Rambla, you'll probably get a better price/quality ratio. Watch out, the internet connection can be unstable, especially if the hotel is full of Mobile World Congress participants with their armada of gadgets.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful hotel with high level of service”
Reviews.Author: OriWei
Reviews.Content: First time at Barcelona and had wonderful time: Location: The location is just perfect, at the center of the Rambla st, did all the trip by walking due to this good location. Service: Lovely and professional, easy to communicate (all workers has good English) and providing good tips for the city. Want to praise and the good work of Toni from the reception who provided a high level of service!!!! with this level of service we would definitely come back. Rooms: We had Rambla room with view and small balcony to Rambla which are very nice. Rooms was also clean and comfortable. Summary: 10 out of 10!!! :] Ori

Reviews.Title: “Great location on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: fabbedyfab
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely weekend break in Barcelona. First impressions, I thought the hotel was clean, approachable staff but maybe a few steps up from a nice hostel. However, the hotel was clean and that is one of the most important things for me! The hotel just needs a few cosmetic upgrades such as the corridor walls repainting, the walls cleaned in the rooms etc. I have a feeling this was being done up ahead of peak season as there were patches on the corridor walls where dents had been filled in. First impressions of the bed, it felt hard and starchy.....but it was actually great and very comfortable! Overall, I think this is a perfect place to stay in Barcelona, great location, clean and great value for money. Few things to note - the hotel doesn't have an iron or an ironing board. If you need something ironed, they have an onsite laundry facility. We requested for something to be ironed, when we got back to the hotel room it had been ironed but then folded instead of arriving on a hanger. So it was just as creased as when it went away! The hotel staff were great about it and gave us the option of having it removed from the bill or the housekeeper to do it again. Secondly, you will occasionally hear a rumble. Couldn't quite figure out what it was at first but it appears to be the metro going directly under the hotel!! We were on the fourth floor so I found this surprising, however it was hardly noticeable after a while and didn't go on through the night. I'm an extremely light sleeper but it didn't bother me at all, I think it was the unlucky positioning of our room! Thirdly, the cleaner on the 4th floor. Beautiful singing voice but not so nice to be woken up to when you're trying to lie in from the night before! This only happened during the week though, the cleaners come round a lot later at weekends. Fourthly, our breakfast wasn't included but on check in we were offered breakfast at the cheaper rate of 9 euros per day instead of 13. We didn't take them up on the offer, however I have to say the breakfast looked lovely in the mornings. Instead we opted to go to the food market 10 minute walk up La Rambla where they had the most amazing fresh fruit and juice drinks (turn left out hotel, 10min walk up on the left). I highly recommend going here. Also along the same way is a beautiful little cafe/bakery where we got croissants. You'll hear a lot of people talk of pick pockets. Yes it is rife there apparently particularly during peak season. But these people are opportunists, they aren't dangerous so it's a case of being sensible. You'll notice all women carrying bags which go across their bodies for example. For example, we heard of someone providing a distraction for tourists which will provide the other perfect opportunity to pick pocket. Just have your wits about you, it's nothing to overly worry about :) I felt incredibly safe by the police patrols round La Rambla. Oh and lots of 'lucky lucky' men down La Rambla and the beach area trying to constantly sell you all sorts of wonderful rubbish... Note from the airport you can get a bus then on the metro to get to La Rambla, this would be the cheapest way. It cost us 30 euros from the airport to La Rambla and 40 the way back to the airport as it was a Sunday?! So bear this in mind when you're planning. You can pick up passes from the airport for day passes on the buses and metro, it's worth doing this if you tend to travel round the city a lot. However, as the hotel is central, a short walk from the gothic quarter, the beach etc the only place we walked to was Sagrada Familia cathedral (took 45mins) so I don't think a pass would be beneficial with the hotel being so central.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hegarty_12
Reviews.Content: staff were very friendly, well situated in centre,have to been very careful of pickpockets.police excellent always around watching everything, felt safer here than some cities in uk. some restaurants very expensive, ask for price of drink before you buy, bought half bottle of wine cost 22 euro, they will rip you off if you don't ask price. downfall was no bar in hotel and sometimes there was a smell but i think you get this in old cities cause shops and streets also smell at certain time. clothes shops excellent and we love barcelona football club,great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: justtrippin18
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the heart or barcelona.. everything is in a walking distance from hotel :) i stayed there while i was on a school trip, and we were all very pleased. even though husa is on rambla, we didn't have trouble sleeping (even during daytime). the food was good, as in any other hotel. rooms were always clean, and the service in general was great! if I ever go to barcelona again (hopefully, I will), I'll definitely stay there again :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: ands_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated centrally on la ramblas and provides an excellent base for sightseeing. The rooms are basic but very clean, reception staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away to see Arctic Monkeys”
Reviews.Author: banks_10
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend come over for a few days to catch a Arctic Monkeys gig in Palau Sant Jordi and found this hotel in a great location,clean,friendly staff and who were also very helpful.i'd definately recommend this hotel. If any young couple or old who are indie music try and catch a gig at any of the many bars,or go to Razzmatazz club which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tammy_118
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed here, the 1st time was over 10 years ago. It was clean and tidy with nice staff. It is very well located in the middle of Las Ramblas with good bars, restaurants and shopping close by. My only gripe was no facilities for making tea/coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Offsidepuppy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona having had a great stay at the oriente. Cannot fault the staff as all were professional, helpful and friendly...the rooms were basic but clean and comfortable and the location could not have been better as was right in the middle of ramblas...for a girls long weekend away we couldn't moan at the price either. All in all, a reasonable price for a great stay in such a beautiful city, I would definitely Stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could wear my heels - very central”
Reviews.Author: bernutty333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend 2 weeks ago. Hotel was nice enough, rooms basic but clean. Beds clean, plenty of towels, good shower. Staff friendly but we didnt make many demands. Very central but although we were facing the front it wasn't particularly noisy. Loved Barcelona, great atmosphere - would happily stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: thegreatgroucho
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in this hotel, Room basic, comfortable and clean. We were given a room at the back of the hotel "because it is quieter", That was true until the party from Hell started on Friday night at 1030 pm and went on at ear-splitting volume until after 4am. No warnings or apologies were offered. Breakfast was poor, we left each morning to find a tapas bar that offered Hot coffee. Location is great but hardly a recommendation, when there are plenty of others around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel J
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated right on the doorstep of the busiest street in Barcelona so the surrounding area was fantastic. Within minutes you are right in the centre of the action. The hotel itself was very clean, well-organised and modern. The only issue were the staff. They weren't that friendly and never really gave off an air of actually wanting to assist you. The wireless was also not working while we were there which was a bit annoying. Other than these minor issues, a good hotel in a great area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks”
Reviews.Author: svk_belgium
Reviews.Content: The good: the location, breakfast was ok, I only staid one night The bad: - Upfront I looked for a quiet room, so I paid extra for the newer rooms with sound-proof windows: Heard everything from the street, and the hallways, and the subway that is somewhere underneath the hotel and makes the room tremble every so many minutes - Since I was arriving late, and traveling alone, I had no intentions of going out at night. I decided to pay extra for a full minibar: first they key wasn’t there, tried to call reception but nobody cared for answering (tried several times), so when I went down I finally got the key and found in my (warm) fridge, 6x 20cl soft drinks. - Going down to the reception again to see if I could get a beer, reception's answer was: yes outside on the Ramblas - Going down to the reception (3rd time already) to ask for the WIFI that did not work I got the answer: yes it is too busy now (11pm) but try later; I assume it works well between 2 AM and 5AM - The beds are rocks with springs, and cardboard pillows - Curtains were torn, so I got Ramblas light in all night - Bathroom: mold everywhere - Reception staff was not helpful at all during all the times I went down Conclusion: No Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheLobus
Reviews.Content: Being a well travelled person, I would seriously warn anyone planning to stay in this hotel to stay well clear and look elsewhere! Basically the noisiest, unpleasant and unhelpful staff with no clue on how to look after guests or indeed a hotel. This place made 'Fawlty Towers' look like the Ritz Carlton. The fire alarm went off at 4.30am on both nights? The noise from the streets outside unbearable through the wafer thins walls and lack of any double glazed windows. Staff rude and unprofessional in handling any matters. When wishing to discuss my complaint at check out, the managers first reaction was to call the police! Even the police officer that arrived looked stunned at the hotels behaviour! I wouldn't wish my worst enemy a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “four nights of smelly hotel”
Reviews.Author: buddevon
Reviews.Content: the hotel was tired and badly in need of upgrade. the carpets to the room where badly stained and the bathroom was dated and had a bad damp smell. location great.breakfast was of poor quality and service was not good.advise to others stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momde_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 3 nights in October. Able to get quiet side rooms upon request at check in which was nice. Pluses are in room safes, decent amount of closet and shelf space, good hot shower (although does splash on the floor a bit) and breakfast until 11 AM (but that might be normal for all hotels in the area). Hotel does not appear to be completely refurbished as the web site says. Hallway carpet old and dirty, rooms o.k. but well worn, basic. The wi-fi never worked at all during our stay, even in the lobby. The front desk didn't seem too concerned about getting it back on, and we were given the name of a neighboring hotel we could go to which took awhile to find. TV's were on the small side, but o.k. and would have been great if we could watch something besides news. Only english channels were CNN, SKY NEWS, and Gallileo (I think). This was a bit of a disappointment because after a day of walking and with kids it is nice to relax and watch a movie (thus the need for internet downloads). Breakfast was basic European fare but adequate. No airconditioning, but windows did open and there was a fan setting, but didn't seem to do much. Had to wait at front desk for help with questions and only 1 or 2 people addressed guests even if 4 were behind the desk. Not overly helpful or friendly, but did answer questions when asked and we had no trouble during check in or check out. Location is good, but such a big city could be a few streets away and it not matter. Food on La Ramlas overpriced and not very good. We did find some good food near harbor, but were charged a lot so if you get something off menu like paella for 3 or the special make sure you know the cost before you order it.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona - Gaudi inspiring but watch yourselvesXXX”
Reviews.Author: RachEmily
Reviews.Content: Simply basic for needs of city explorer terrace bar on Las Ramblas. Watch out for people whom help themselves to your pockets!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, stay here if you want to be amongst it!”
Reviews.Author: Pojkr
Reviews.Content: Booked and cancelled a few hotels before settling on the Husa Orient and glad we did. Had been to Barcelona before and stayed at the Hilton which was nice but miles from everything. If you are on a short break and want to immerse yourself in the Ramblas and the old town then this is a brilliant option. It's a genuine, clean 3 star which has elements of faded grader to make it feel more up Market then the price. Rooms are basic but clean. Had some room confusion when we got there which reception solved and threw in breakfast each day too. Was in Barcelona for girlfriends dads 65th bday, everyone else were in different hotels, all had hotel envy of us due to our location. The bar on the ramblas outside our hotel became our nightly meeting spot. We had a city view room which includes a balcony of the ramblas. Not for light sleepers but we loved it. Felt amongst it the moment we awoke. Getting ready for the day with the sights and sounds of the city as a backdrop made our stay just perfect. Paid around £100 a night for this. Worth it for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: PauloandJulie
Reviews.Content: We booked as a "top secret" hotel through lastminute.com and were worried about what to expect when we read some of the tripadvisor reviews. As soon as we checked in, our fears evaporated. The staff were excellent - very helpful and friendly - and the room, which overlooked a courtyard, was quiet, smart and comfortable. The hotel has character and the location really is unbeatable. Very solid 3 star hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary a lot. Bad security & wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: TravelInYourFifties
Reviews.Content: The good news is that the location is excellent, just down the street from the Metro on La Rambla . . . and the water pressure in the shower was good. The bad news is that the room size and features vary widely and ours wasn't good. For $200/night it was a terrible disappointment. Our room was marginally bigger than the bed which was hard and creaky. The room did contain a safe which was good since the security was awful. The rooms in our wing all have key locks, so there's no way to tell how many keys are floating around. When you leave the hotel, they have a slot to leave the key (ideally so that it doesn't get stolen while you are out?). The problem is that they just hang it up in plain sight behind the desk so that anyone can tell if the room is empty or not. And you just ask for a room key by number with no verification so anyone can just pick it up. The carpet in the hallway was absolutely filthy and the Wi-Fi was as good as non-existent. If you tried long enough you could connect and sometimes even exchange some data, but it was totally frustrating. We tried multiple devices which work flawlessly elsewhere so they have a definite problem. We couldn't even get to Tripadvisor to find a good place for dinner! We were there for 3 nights and it was a consistent problem. It did seem that there were much larger rooms than ours and in some areas, the doors had a keycard reader instead of a key, so it may be that there are some better rooms available, but be careful. And I can't imagine how much they charge for the bigger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nir N
Reviews.Content: We (a couple) stayed at the hotel during the La Merce festival. The hotel is located right in the heart of things. The breakfast was quite good, the rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff was nice and helpful. The only downside is the noise from the rambla but we managed to solve this by asking for a side room. In short: Good value for money, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You can NOT beat this location!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedRonda
Reviews.Content: Once a monistary this hotel delivers location, location, location and at a very compeditive value. At 45 La Ramblas it is in the heart of things to see and do. We were two adults traveling with an 11 year old child and we got a tripple room. It was comfortable, large bath, a bit crowded with the three single beds that we had requested but it fit our needs nicely. There was an issue with the internet connection and we never could get it to work in our room but it did work in the lobby. Breakfast at the hotel was more expensive than what was redily available literally across the street but in a lovely room!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY NO BETTER LOCATION POSSIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: ijung
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this centrally located hotel for 2 nights at the end of August 2011. I had a very spacious room with direct view on the Ramblas! This is one of the oldest hotels in Barcelona, and this can be noticed at the beautiful ancient facade and the large corridors. The staff is very friendly, and the breakfast room is surprisingly modern. All major city attractions are at walking distance. Relation price-quality is extremely honest! I will definitely return...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: ak24
Reviews.Content: Great location, hotel is a bit plain but rooms are clean and as we didnt spend much time there we didnt mind.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Jason P
Reviews.Content: After staying at the excellent aramunt apartments we headed to the Oriente for our final night in barcelona. Things started very well with the reception staff being very helpfull and speedy in checking us in. The hotel is looking like it has seen better days as the carpets on the way tot he room were quite threadbare and the smell in the corridors is quite musty. No electronic locks on the door so I had been given a key and an electronic keycard to activate the room aircon, lights etc....I hunted high and low for somewhere to put this key so I could switch on the air con but could not find anywhere to put it, eventualy found that I did not need it!!!! The room itself was nothing special but large enough for 2 adults and 2 children thankfully on the side of the hotel so away from the noise of la rambla, unfortunately our friends were at the front and their night was spent with the outside noise competing with a particularly noisy and fairly ineffective air con unit. The kids loved the balcony though (I dont recommend small children on it though) where we could look up the street to la rambla and the pleasure of seeing a couple of pickpockets being arrested which was quite entertaining!!! We did not eat in the hotel as the breakfast to be honest was expensive so walked about 50m down the road and found a fabulous little cafe at a fraction of the price. On the whole good service but the hotel is in need of some tender loving care as it seems to have been neglected a bit. if you get a really good deal then it is worth it for the location otherwise there are much better hotels for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: indi k
Reviews.Content: Great service!! very helpfull staff. nice clean room and bathroom. brill location!! deff return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, not so helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: IdaKP
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location in central Barcelona (La Rambla it self is not worth spending much time in though). We had a room facing the back yard (ask for it!) and was not at all bothered by any noise. The room was clean and quite large. Comfortable bed. However, the staff was not very helpful at all; we had trouble connecting to the free wifi, but they showet no effort at all to help us. Apparently the network is, for some reason, not available on iPhone.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived to find they had overbooked and didn't have a room for us.”
Reviews.Author: jmweb
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room on-line with the hotel, since we had visited there last year and liked it very much. When we arrived we were told there had been a computer problem, and they didn't have a room for us. They moved us to a hotel down the street (International Cool Local Hotel) which was not nearly as nice. The room there was clean, but was small and dark, and the entrance was small and a bit creepy. A great disappointment, to say the least. This cast a pall over our time in Barcelona, and the experience means we will never reserve at the Oriente again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SanjitPaulSingh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in the center of all excitement on Las Ramblas. The staff is extremely helpful, and provided us with the correct guidance on meals locations and cabs whenever needed. Noise levels due to activity on Ramblas are high. We did not try the food. The sheets and bathrooms are clean, and we faced no bugs at all-read in earlier reviews. Excellent value for money given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: simplythebest_2511
Reviews.Content: This was an organised trip.I wouldn't want it to reflect on the organisation of the trip it was handled really well.And i was in heaven as to why we were on it.I won't divulge it may upset the organisers.But i have to say the hotel was appalling,i know it was 3 star but really it had nothing to offer.It might as well be a B & B of the worst kind.The most uncomfiest bed ,pillow,1 only each. The breakfast shocking.I might go for a month i could loose a lot of weight.It has put me off Barcelona.I have been before on a 1 night stop over i had a completely different view on that occasion.Aviod the Rambla.Noise, dirty and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Read to the end - do not dare go there!”
Reviews.Author: EDRI555
Reviews.Content: This month I spent the 2 last night of my vacation in this hotel after we did cruise in Europe. We were about 21 people -4 families. Our group did booking for this hotel follow my recommendation because I had good impression from my last visit 2 years ago. On 7/10/11 we arrived at 09:00am with our suitcases and left those at the hotel, after we were told that only at two o'clock we can do check in. When we arrived at 2 there were 20 people waiting for check in, the reception includes only 2 people who one of them was new in his job. The computer & the printer didn’t work. All the people around were exhausted, tired & started to complain as it took 3 hours to receive the rooms!!! Our rooms were dirty and the sheets were torn. The peak was at breakfast the next morning . I went to breakfast with my little daughter who went out & running into the street, I went after her and the waiter noticed. When I returned he commented to me before all the guests that I cannot eat breakfast twice! the waiter was rude for the childrens also. Needless to say that I was very hurt and I was very embarrassed, even though I explained to him the above he continued to say it loudly. follow it I asked to speak with the manager – Mr.Seca (hope I spell it right) and in the reception I was told he could not meet me as he is over loaded with his job. I didn’t gave up & I realized that the employees protect each other and nothing was told to him. I saw him in his room and asked if I can come in. He greeted me warmly and I was so upset that I started crying when I explained what happened. I demanded to receive an apology and he called the waiter named Abdullah (hope I spell it right), and asked him to apologize. Mr.Seca also proposed to compensate me with a drink during the day in their Bar. Of course I didn’t go to the Bar & furthermore during all day I was very upset.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likesthebesthotels
Reviews.Content: I agree completely with Gideon123 in his review on this hotel. If you want to stay in this area, the location is great - but La Rambla / the area is packed with hotels, and you will easily find another one much, much better. I paid EUR 145 for a simple room facing La Rambla - absolutely not worth it.. I had read in our guide that one should notice the reception area - that´s a mystery ! The reception is shabby and messy and the staff is far too busy. The room was very simple with plastic floors trying to look like wooden floors. The bathroom was old - very disappointing. The internet didn´t work. I had seen several reviews with travellers complaining, and the staff saying it was due to too many users etc. When booking the room I should have had that in mind instead of thinking that they would have solved the problem until then. I´m not so sure that the so called free internet is existing at all. It didn´t work in the early afternoon, it didn´t work 1 o´clock in the night, and it didn´t work 7 in the morning. Worst thing was that the staff seemed not to care. They looked tired and said it was because of the management. We checked out after one night returning to the wonderful Hotel Alma - a bit more expensive, but so much more comfortable and beautiful with a truly kind and helpful staff. I repeat Gideon123 saying: Please don't stay at the Husa Oriente. You will only regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Gideon12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the kind that gives Spanish hotels a bad name. Please don't stay here - Barcelona has so much better. Arrived at tatty reception where a bevy of staff tried to check me in. The place had a air of decay - it really looked awful. Maybe the rooms were better I hoped. They weren't my room was monastically bare, had a small window looking into a light well and stank of cigarette smoke. Even the light switch was held together with tape and the telephone didn't work. I went back to reception to ask for another room. "The hotel is full, so it's that or nothing". I said "I don't think so". They said "Think it"!! I told them it was still possible to book online. "I'll show you another room". The next room was no better apart from that it didn't stink. On the assumption that these rooms were typical, you can expect a small box with a TV with poor signal, uncomfortable beds, the ability to hear everything said in the corridor, no fridge, a shower that floods the whole bathroom with water that fluctuates from hot to freezing depending on whether someone else had the same idea to shower...I could keep going on. The staff are something else entirely. It seems that there are some senior staff who exist to tell guests to put up or shut up, and junior staff who watch and learn. When I went to reception to get some water the senior receptionist seemed irate that had I dared to speak to him and ignored me completely. His junior told me to go find a shop as they had run out! So while the location is good and the rooms are cleanish, for exactly the same price you can find something modern and quiet where the staff actually give a damn. Please don't stay here. You will only regret it.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: saintlyjo
Reviews.Content: Right on Las Ramblas - excellent location - and very good service. Made our stay in Barcelona very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: michaelpohlin
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Step out onto the La Rambla. Very close to harbor and shops. Room is clean but not modern. Receptionist Nick is very helpful with all kinds of information. Breakfast is ok. Nothing special. Free wifi available in hotel. Also free wifi internet in McDonald across the road. Taxi cost to cruise terminal approx 15 to 20 Euros. If you like you can drag your lagguage to shuttle terminal about 10 minutes walk from hotel. Fares 2 euros. to cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Had a terrible dinner”
Reviews.Author: irishtalian
Reviews.Content: we had a terrible dinner. the tapas were ugly, look like yesterday food. Paella was not tasty, couldn't eat it. pint of beer for 14.50 euro, was a robbery! service ... there was no service! very disapointed evening.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but don't expect much sleep”
Reviews.Author: Johnpollard5
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the Ramblas for seeing the Gothic Quarter and sea front. At the other end of the Ramblas is the Square from which all the excellent touristico buses depart e.g. tour of Gaudi buildings, `get on, get off buses' allow you to stop off at, for example the wondefully situated Miro gallery: then get on another bus on the same ticket for return. Hotel has spacious rooms with excellent bathrooms. However, the night-long noise of revellers on the Ramblas makes sleep difficult: after Barcelona's 8-0 win last week, Barcelonians shouted outside as onlhy Barcelonians can shout, until around 6 a.m. Then, at 6.30 a giant crane arrived in the narrow passage outside the Hotel and began hoisting heavy objects to the adjacent roof top. Very helpful service at reception; rather crowded at breakfast, but most agreeable breakfast room, top-lit; no other meals served, but numerous restaurants very near to suit all pockets. Very agreeable to be able to step out of the Hotel on to the Ramblas by day. No sign of pickpockets, although everyone still warns you about them. Superb indoor vegetable and fruit market a few yards away, where you can buy prepared packets of fresh fruit such as restaurants never serve.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: aminozuur
Reviews.Content: I was there with my two uncles for a week and I was very pleased with the room, we had one room with 3 seperate beds. The location is absolutely PERFECT, seriously, it couldn't be any better. You're surrounded by the whole city center and everything is nearby so you could walk.. You can even walk to the beach. My uncles were a bit lazy so we went by taxi (it just 4 or 5 euro's to the beach). Everything is nearby. The rooms are very clean and look good, and the airconditioner worked well. We had a nice brown wooden floor and a nice bathroom. If you look out the window you see a McDonalds and a KFC :). Our room had a very little balcony, even though you could only stand on the balcony it was still good because it allowed me to smoke a cigarette there :). There was a breakfast but it wasn't included with our stay, but we went there to take a look and it looked very delicious. If we wanted we could pay extra for breakfast but it was €13 a day for an open buffet. A bit too expensive since a nice breakfast outdoors is twice as cheap. The staff was also friendly and there was always somebody who spoke English, they were really helpful and provided us with information about museums and stuff..

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: b0diddly
Reviews.Content: It's a 3* hotel right on Las Ramblas. Couldn't get any closer to the action which is a 24/7 phenomenon. The room was a bit small but more than adequate - very clean and surpisingly quiet and comfortable. We were expecting to have disturbed nights due to the proximity of Las Ramblas but no racket at all. Breakfast was very good too. No bar or restaurant but they are everywhere outside. The hotel did exactly what it says on the tin! Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Eaten by bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: jojoSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Hotel is amazingly located on Las Ramblas. Service was nice. Avoid rooms with carpet. We found a bug in the bed but dind't think any further. The day after we were covered with 30+ bedbug bites. Now we just hope we didn't carry their eggs back home with us. Because they survive a full year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location, but don't bother with breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: STAR1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 years ago & had room facing the La Rambla's, very noisy but interesting to watch people walking up & down. Stayed again the weekend just gone for 3 nights. I must admit that I was a bit worried after reading other people's comments about having items stolen from their rooms, credit cards being able to unlock doors etc. First thing I did on arrival to my room was try my credit card in the door - nothing happened thank god! The safe in our room was broken so we used one in another room where other family members were staying which was fine. The hotel did offer for us to use their safe but I wasn't sure about that due to the thefts I read about. I kept some valuables in my suitcase which I locked & placed in a cupboard with clothes laying on the top so I could check if anyone had tampered with it, I'm pleased to say they hadn't. The room was basic but modern & clean, the shower was powerful but leaked everywhere! We had a room facing inwards away from the La Rambla's, overlooking the breakfast conservatory - very quiet, so if you don't want to be kept awake till stupid o'clock by over looking the Rambla's request an inwards facing room! Now on to the breakfast - don't expect a full english! The breakfast basically consists of a small selection of ham & cheese, donuts, croissants, bread, weird scrambled egg with fruity bits, streaky bacon barely cooked & smoked spicy sausages, we only managed one breakfast, the other two mornings we found somewhere else! Overall we had a pleasant stay & staff were very friendly. There is one English guy who works on reception, so if you have any queries or problems you might want to speak with him. For getting about, first time we visited we used the tour buses, this time we used the metro - fantastic, I would recommend to anyone. Quick, convenient & easy to use. 10 trips costs 7.50 euro's. You can get anywhere in the city centre in no time at all. Please take notice of this part - WATCH OUT FOR PICK POCKETS! they use distraction techniques to try to steal your purse or wallet, I wore a money belt under my clothes & only kept a small amount of money in my hand bag. Cross over bags are a must for us girls!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Trippet154943
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to Barcelona for my husband and I and we were very lucky to find this great hotel in Las Ramblas. We were given a room surprisingly modern for the hotel location overseeing Las Ramblas. Regardless the crowds coming and going in that busy street we could not hear any noise from our room. The breakfast variety was amazing (we loved the sausage variety and cold cuts) and the breakfast room was gorgeous. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and gave us great pointers to local attractions and dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Bad Service - Electronics were stolen from Room”
Reviews.Author: rosied20
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on the ramblas good location - we had a triple room as there was 3 of us girls. On the 2nd night there all 3 of our camera chargers were stolen and ipod chargers along with Ipohone chargers and my Apple Itouch Ipod - these were inside our cases at the bottom therefore our clothes were rummaged throughly. We reported this to reception and were told the MD will deal with this not to worry as it is hotel reputation on line. In the morning however new person at reception new story - we got told hotel can not do anything as any passer by can enter the room there is no secuirty cameras in our lobby and quoted by receptionist 'anyone with a credit card can open the door' they refused to blame the cleaning staff or the ironing lady (no irons available in the hotel only a lady comes to iron if you require the service). Went to report it to the police station no transalator available until next day and we had to leave. they have said to us they are refunding the accomodation paid still no sign of this through the bank but it doesnt cover the total cost of our goods being stolen - my ipod was two years old so do not have receipts therfore cant claim anything back from insurance.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING, BE CAREFUL OF ALL YOUR BELONGINGS”
Reviews.Author: svo19
Reviews.Content: We were robbed blind over a two night stay just last weekend. The maid (I imagine) Stole DVD's, prescription drugs, small gifts (key chains, magnets) the kids had purchased the first day, and my blackberry, whick basically almost ruined our whole trip. We checked out to go to a cruise and I realized our backpack had been cleaned out over the two days, things I assumed the kids had packed away or misplaced were all missing. The DVDs were stolen right off the desk. The front desk were far from helpful, had a complete attitude the whole time we were there, and were not fond of americans, even though we are fluent spanish, overall the experience was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Avagsd
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an ideal location half way down La Rambla so it is central to all ameneties. Our room was clean and had a maid service, with beds made and clean towels daily. The staff were particularly helpful, especially Nicolas who could not have been more pleasant if he tried. A very enjoyable break in a lovely hotel in a fabulous city. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION IDEAL !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rafared83
Reviews.Content: As many have said this is right on the rambles , at the beach end so a small walk there too. Plenty of restaurants bars on the rambles , but i would avoid spending all your time their as you will pay over the odds for food/ drinks. The hotel itself very clean tidy and reception welcoming. The noise is a slight problem if you get a room over les rambles i would ask for a room at the back if i was to go again. but overall value for money you cant get a better location.................

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gallienus
Reviews.Content: Despite the good location (right on the Ramblas, if that's what you're after), the staff were indifferent to guest concerns and not at all knowledgeable about the area around the hotel. The shower and sink water came out slightly brown! The lights in the room were controlled by an energy saving tool that the staff did not explain until we came back down to the lobby to question whether the lights even worked. Overpriced and over-hyped for what we got, which was little more than a bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “It is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in... a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: rucaPorto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very old room, very small and cold. The window did not close and the noise and wind entered in the room all night long. When we arrived at the hotel, in one of the days, the door of the room was straight opened. The bed was very uncomfortable and there was no extra pillows or blankets. The sheets were torn. The mini bar space was empty (not even the refrigerator was there). When we asked for a botle of water and extra blankets at 10 p.m., the person in the reception told us to ask in the next morning, because it was not available at that hour. Last, but not the least, when we complained about the room, the hotel responsable agreed that we had reason, but he did not even changed our room. If you get there by car, you do not have any place to park nearby without paying a lot of money (not even to load and unload the car, because the places reserved to it are always occupied with vehicles of the staff).

Reviews.Title: “early morning call whether you request one or not (the chambermaids !)”
Reviews.Author: travellingcouple00
Reviews.Content: no air conditioning,no climate control,no free internet. our first room was like a oven,patio doors did not open(looked like they had been crow-barred)no air conditioning,no climate control except hot! we were moved to another room after complaining although smaller with two single beds it had an opening window-straight onto a fire escape,so could not leave open for ventilation as somebody could climb into the room. The chambermaids started work at 8.o'clock ,very noisily so even if you didn't request an early morning call you got one! On a plus the location is very good for all local amenities

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EithneBelfast
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great location wise. Right in the heart of Barcelona on La Rambla. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean and spacious. Breakfast was not included in our trip but we paid €15 per person on the first morning to have their breakfast. The choice was plentiful, everything you could want and imagine but still I felt this was quite expensive for Barcelona! Outside the hotel at night was quite noisey but that didn't bother us as it was due to the location and we had expected that. If you are a light sleeper it may bother you.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyIlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Barcelona and we stayed at the Husa Oriente for 3 nights. We were really impressed by this beautiful building which has a lot of charachter and were very happy with our Deluxe room as it was very spacious , clean and comfortable(minimalistic style ) with a balcony looking right on to La Ramblas - when french doors were closed at night time the room was pretty quiet and we slept really well. .We loved being in this area as we had so many great restaruants and tapas bars close by. Also the open top Bus Turistic is a great way to see the city and surrounding area !!

Reviews.Title: “Historical building with modern rooms on a popular street!”
Reviews.Author: SabiniInday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriente for three nights at the end of our trip. I chose the hotel because of the location and the price. I also read that it once upon a time it was a favorite of Ernest Hemingway. We arrived late on a Saturday night after a long train ride from Pamplona. I'm glad that it's so close to the metro and just a few stops away from Barcelona Sants. We were able to check in right away and had a room on the first floor (second if your American) looking over La Rambla. The room was huge! I was always told that rooms in Europe were small, and so far all of ours were. Except for this one. It was also pretty clean. It was incredibly noisy, but we expected that. I don't think I expected it to be noisy until the sun came out, but it was. All and all it was a great value for a convenient location and a large, clean room. Though next time I won't be staying so close to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE BLAZER STOLEN...nice hotel except for THEFT!!!”
Reviews.Author: caroline8448
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before a cruise 9/12-9/13. Hotel is beautiful and we got a room in the back which was nice and quiet. HOWEVER when our luggage was in lock up an expensive blazer with gold monogrammed buttons was STOLEN. Efforts to contact the hotel and their parent company have been FRUITLESS! Not a very good start to a vacation that should have been wonderful. I would not trust this hotel with any of my belongings

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in the heart of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lizbex
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I felt a little nervous but this hotel was great! Ideal central location on Las Ramblas (couldn't be better) The rooms were really spacious, clean and surprisingly trendy (as the exterior is very traditional) Fantastic modern bathrooms ! The breakfasts weren't great but were buffet- style so something could be found to eat ! Altogether great & good value

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice and Clean and very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Woody2403
Reviews.Content: I got back from staying at teh Husa Oriente about 2 days ago. It was my first trip to Barcelona and the hotel was very conveniently placed in the centre of La Rambla - you literally walk out of te hotel and you are in the centre of where it all happens! I went during La Merce festival so La Rambla was very very busy and we had a front room facing the street which we requested so we could be in with the hustle and bustle all the time and we were! If you want a quiet nights sleep request a back room (they asked us which we would prefer) as La Ramblas never sleeps! The rooms were lovely and spacious and the hotel gives a nice "grand" feeling, with gold and high ceilings. We never ate breakfast here so cannot comment that far. We booked through Easy Jet and paid £100 PER PERSON for 3 nights which was great value for being so central during festival time. The only thing I would say is that I had a valuable coat go missign from my room even though we specifically put the Do Not Disturb sign on the door the whole time to prevent anything going missing - I dont know if it was through my carelessness but Im 100% certain the coat was in teh room adn then it wasnt so I will leave that for your own judgement. If I was going back to Barcelona, I would definitely stay here again - I just would watch which coat I took with me!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - just book a room round the back!”
Reviews.Author: joromunki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during a city break for my husband's birthday. The hotel is right in the middle of Las Ramblas, the main tourist street, so is in an ideal location to see the sights. Check in was efficient (although we did have to wait a while for the lady to see to us. She was busy playing solitaire on her pc I think!!) and the staff speak relatively good English. We had booked a room whch over looked the cloisters at the back, as the noise from Las Ramblas is non stop, and I'm really glad we did. The hotel itself is very grand, with marble staircases and ornate ceilings etc. Very nice. Our room was on the third floor and there is a lift service. The room was basic but functional and clean. My only complaint was the lack of pillows - we only had one each! Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Arnster
Reviews.Content: I found the place to be clean and superbly located, Yes you can hear the street noise outside, we had a side room on the third floor the noise rebounds off all the adjacent buildings. I found the staff very helpful. We stayed for three nights which was enough for us. You can get through a lot of cash in a short time! The only pick pockets we encountered were on the metro, they dropped a load of coins to distract people then made use of the diversion to rob an old fellow

Reviews.Title: “I asked for a room facing the back after reading here about the noise…”
Reviews.Author: EliToy
Reviews.Content: We got a sweet renovated room, pretty small but sufficient for a couple. No noise problems!! A small fridge would make me happier. We really liked the food on the first day and on the second but later on we got bored with it (same buffet every day) Location: just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a quick, lively break”
Reviews.Author: LeedsGuy69
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the Ramblas, yards from a Metro station. The train from the airport takes around 30 mins and you need to change once at Sans station, but it's pretty painless to get there. Obviously as it's on the Ramblas itself, there's plenty of noise outside as you should expect, so ignore the complaints from other reviewers who seem to think it's location should be quieter.. (serves them right for booking a hotel on one of the most famously busy streets in the world!). I'd say the noise level was comperable to Oxford street in London - sirens, drunken shouts, horns etc, but no more than you'd expect. My room (404) overlooked the street on the top floor, but with the a/c on and the windows shut, the noise level was fine. The staff are great and gave me the option of a quieter, internal facing room. The room was clean and well maintained - for £25 a night (booked via Easyjet) I was expecting much less. The hotel's own website does make it look much more elegant than it appeared to me, but I didn't go anywhere in the hotel except from reception to my room, so I'm sure the grand looking dining room was in there somewhere! Overall, it's a cheap and cheerful, well appointed hotel and well worth a look if you're planning a lively break in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Thiefs stole my Laptop”
Reviews.Author: harpy01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, prices can vary, nights may be noisy. This was my second stay at the hotel and I got a MUCH smaller room at a MUCH worse rate....also, my laptop was stolen while I was checking in at the reception desk...so be careful. Their security should be much better and it is something that they should upgrade immediately. Rooms are comfortable and staff friendly. I got an excellent room, supposedly a 260 euro room, for 93 euros online the first time I stayed - I think they just dish out the rooms as people arrive!!!

Reviews.Title: “well placed and well served”
Reviews.Author: DCFMalaga
Reviews.Content: A welcoming front desk and helpful staff. Clean rooms.Fresh smells. excellent position for Barcelona. We had rooms overlooking the Ramblas but we all slept very well as the rooms were sound proofed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: wigsterReading
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean, but I found them quite small with limited storage space (we finished up having to keep the suitcases under the bed). As others have said, the bedding is limited, but we found it sufficient, and did not need to ask for more. They were also sparsely equipped, with no fridge or tea/coffee facilities. The TV also only seemed to have terrestrial channels, with no English speaking ones available. We had no problems with our air con, and there was a small (free to use) safe in the wardrobe. The noise is probably the biggest problem with this hotel, and not just from La Ramblas. The sound insulation in the corridors is very poor, and you can hear every door close, and people talking in the corridor quite distinctly. However, I am sure that some of this is down to it having formerly been a convent, and there is a lot of marble used around the corridors, which does look great. We found the staff to be friendly and accomodating, and all (fortunately) spoke a reasonable amount of English. They were quite happy to swap us from a twin to a double room as well. The breakfasts I found to be quite acceptable, with a reasonable range of choices, although they were the same choices every day which did get a bit tiresome on the 7th & 8th days!) If you want to explore the city, and aren't early birds, then the location is excellent. Very close to one of the Metro stations, and within easy walking distance of the harbour, old cathedral, and several of the other primary attractions.

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel, polite staff”
Reviews.Author: y1n9
Reviews.Content: Found no problem with the staff at all. Check in and check out was efficient, they even kept our luggage for us on the last day whilst we went out. We were given a room on the 2nd floor. It was evident that half the hotel had just been under some refurbishment works since some doors had keycard locks whilst others didn't. We had a room in the older wing, but I thought the room was fine. We could hear noise at night but nothing that kept me from sleeping. However, they gave 2 thin sheets instead of a thin light duvet. This could be standard across hotels in Barcelona, so I'm not too sure. Springs in the mattress did creak abit. They don't have a kettle for hot drinks, but I didn't need one anyway. I managed to book 4 nights with this hotel on a pretty good deal ( £120 pp sharing a double with my boyfriend)... So I think I got what I paid for. I don't think I would have paid the full price advertised on their website for the same room however. I can not emphasise enough on how well located this hotel is. I read reviews that mentioned problems of prostitutes and pickpockets around the area. Unfortunately, they are around but this applies in most major cities. Just don't leave yourself vulnerable and avoid dressing too tourist-like

Reviews.Title: “Central and Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brazucanomundo
Reviews.Content: My first room was roomy and nice, with a good bathroom. On the third day of my five days stay, the nap broked and the staff transfered me and my wife to a very noisy room with twin beds. The staff is indiferent, many rooms ane noisy and the furniture is old. But is clean and well located to explore the central Bracelona.

Reviews.Title: “good location but rude staff, luggage stolen from room yet no help from staff”
Reviews.Author: manish2001
Reviews.Content: Good location, but unfriendly staff, luggage stolen from room yet no help from staff, did not even give complain form, noisy during night time

Reviews.Title: “Husa Oriente, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JofromWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic. We booked it on line and confirmed the booking via email with the hotel. Reception is fairly nice, lifts are ok and rooms are basic and rather shabby, although the hotel is being renovated and as we got a cheap room, it was a room they hadn't got to yet, so should all be done by now. The room is spacious enough with a good size wardrobe and drawers, a decent size bed and bedside tables and a desk with chair and tv. Think there was only one channel in English but weren't in the room that much so didn' care. It is rather noisy and even with the patio door closed, it sounded like it was open as its directly over La Rambla, which really is 24/7, so good if you get peckish at 4am but not so good if you then want to sleep. Also this hotel is rather too close to the red light district for my liking and lots of hookers in front of hotel, although this is true all up the Rambla. Didn't cause any trouble and the ladies of the night are very friendly and share a joke and my boyfriend even got his bum pinched...no charge ;-) In honesty, I wouldn't book this place again as its a bit seedy, I'd rather stay at Hotel Colon which is a short walk away but opens onto a gorgeous square opposite the cathedral, but its a lot more expensive I'm guessing! The location is fine for pubs, clubs, shopping and sightseeing, but I'd try somewhere new next time. Its right in front of the underground station 'Liceu'. Peole tell you to get underground passes but I would avoid and just buy day tickets or individual ones as you tend to walk a lot round Barcelona. Sagrada Famile is a fair distance away (45 mins or so) and the Barcelona New Camp Footy Stadium is also a fair distance away on underground and then a good walk after, so allow approx 1 hour travel time from La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: nobreadalone
Reviews.Content: In the center of La Rambla, it was close to everything any tourist could ask for. We had rooms right at the front, and were woken at 3 or 4am with drunken shouts or car alarms. It was an experience in itself. But we still enjoyed the position. We were told to walk to the St Mary of the Sea Cathedral where the food was authentic and cheap. There were lots of boutiques along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: travellingchick81
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel on La Ramblas is fantastic, as you are on the main street and a quick walk from the Port and there is a metro station just outside the door. Due to its proximity to the street, and some not so savoury nightclubs, we were awake most of the night on the Friday from yelling and screaming bar customers, although Saturday was a little quieter. If you need a restful night, this is probably not the place, however the rooms were clean, the staff slightly rude but still efficient and the location was the best part.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel just very noisy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicliz
Reviews.Content: just returned from a stay at the oriente.we spent 4 nights here,the hotel is in a fantastic location right in the centre of the ramblas and convienient for everywhere.its a very nice imposing place with a lovely grand facade very attractive.inside this grandeur continues albeit in a faded manner which we found extremely charming.the sweeping staircase was lovely and all the public areas were really nice.our room was perfectly fine for a city break basic functional furniture and bathroom but that is all we need for a weekend of sightseeing.personally we dont feel the need for free toilitries or extras in a hotel room when we are only in it to sleep and shower.an english speaking tv channel would have been nice though ,if only for the news.the worst problem was the noise.our room was facing the side street at the side of the hotel and the noise on our 1st night,sat was horrendous.endless shouting and screaming from people down below.would definitley recommend earplugs to get a full nights rest.we also found that the room walls were very thin.we could hear our neighbours clearly whenever they were in their room and were glad that they were quiet.breakfast was really nice with a great selection of nice things to eat.we certainley didnt struggle for choice.it was included in our deal so felt very happy to have it.we have definitley had much worse on our travels,in fact this was one of our best ones!! the location of the oriente certainly made up for any niggles we had.the ramblas is the heart of town and you can go anywhere from it.the old town is right across the road and its 10mins to the cathederal.at nights we tended to go further afield to eat as the prices were ludicrous in town.the cost of things was the very worst thing about our trip, we have never been anywhere so expensive and we,ve travelled extensively.nobody likes to feel ripped off and sadly in barcelona it was hard not to.we are always prepared to wander a good way out of town to eat but here it could be a scary thing to do .the atmoshere at night in town had an edge to it there were lots of potentially dodgy people around. while we were on the beach in the middle of the day we watched a guy stealing bags which soured thw whole beach thing and at night there were quite a few moments where we didnt feel at all safe.even in new york i felt much safer than here.a very sad part of our trip as it does spoil things.if you went down the side street next to our hotel you were in an area called el raval, this area was not great even in broad daylight and we felt uncomfortable every time we went that way.on our last night we were approached just 10 yards away from the ramblas in the old town by some lads and the situation was again scary.for that and the high prices i probably wouldnt return to barcelona.the one reason i would return is when they get the sagrada finished. to say its amazing is understatement, i would dearly love to see it completed.if we were to return we would have no hesitation in staying at the oriente just with earplugs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view and nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: jennykenny
Reviews.Content: The room itself was fine, but talk about scrimping - no mini bar or fridge, one blanket & pillow per person, no cushions, no notepaper, one hard wooden chair for two adults, (when I explained to reception that we liked to spend time reading on holiday and could we please have two comfy chairs - they sent another hard wooden one), no toiletries except the minimum soap and shower gel, one toilet roll, no toilet brush (did they think we were going to steal it), and towels were definitely not in the luxury class. There was no sound proofing and while it was great to be overlooking Las Ramblas (I imagine that's what we paid 160 euros a night for - no breakfast) it was annoying to be kept awake all night by the crowds below. No bar in the hotel, and the reception never, ever reply to emails. No matter how many times we emailed or phoned (we both speak Spanish) we couldn't get a final confirmation of our booking. Pleasant English guy on reception - Nicholas - but not a place we will ever go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Boys Pissup”
Reviews.Author: juggy2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. Services, Staff and food were very good! Also had a room with balcony and AC which was excellent. Only qualms where that being in such a elite location within the city, prices were very high for drinks and food. By vernturing out a few hundred metres from the town can save you a lot of money. If you can afford it, i would reccomend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: mimiK100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend, booked online direct with hotel. Went with a few mates (about 10 of us). The rooms are tiny, really really small and my room was overlooking La Ramblas and there was no double glazing so it was like sleeping on the street, we didn't care really as we got in late both nights. Can't remember how much we paid but it wasn't too much and they were friendly enough. The hotel seemed really quiet which is good for lads weekends so you don't get many complaints if you come in late. Don't eat on ramblas though, crap food & really expensive. Recommend the hotel for a weekend away where you just want to lay your head. Barcelona is a great spot, really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location on the Ramblas near the port and most sights!”
Reviews.Author: One4travel
Reviews.Content: Having been to Barcelona several times in the past, we knew we wanted to stay on the Ramblas. In a city as popular and often visited by tourists as Barcelona, the Husa Oriente is a reasonably priced hotel . It is an excellent choice for a pre-cruise stay, as its location is very near to the port and within easy access to Barcelona's many sights, like the Gothic Quarter. We booked a room on a high floor to help isolate ourselves somewhat from the ongoing noise of the busy Ramblas, so my husband and I had no difficulty sleeping without earplugs. Although not fancy, our room was clean and the air conditioner worked perfectly. We also found the Oriente's staff to be very helpful. We started each of our days of sightseeing with a full stomach after enjoying our free hot buffet breakfast in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great but don"t expect a bellboy to help you.”
Reviews.Author: travelingicon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay. the room was right on the las ramblas. it was fun. the place seemed clean,too. the staff however were not so friendly. when we got there we had to move a "bellhop" out of the way so we could get in the door. not once did he stop his smoking and ask to help us. too bad, we tip really well. the same happened to us as we were leaving. maybe no one ever told them that a bellhop's job was to assist the hotel guest with their luggage , etc..

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tolsty
Reviews.Content: We"ve been in Oriente 2 nights on September. Perfect location. Nice simple rooms. All the rooms was renovated this year. Very comfy beds (but just better ask for an extra pillow). Yes, it is noisy. Wouldnt recomend a breakfast in the hotel. Its lovely to have your cafe on Ramblas. But realy - just cafe. As about propal meal - Ramblas offer terrible service and bad food. Try Tapas bar "Bilbao" in Piazza Nuova (not far from the hotel) and absolutly lovely Oysters Bar "Vildsvin" in Ferran street, 38 (3 min. walking).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: saby92
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible location, right on La Rambla. Basically, you stepped out the front door and their ws the entire night scene in front of you. Also right in front of the Liceu metro station. The room was great - very clean and the bathroom was large. The room was also air conditions. Noise was not a factor during our stay - it was on our minds after reading other reviews but it was truly not loud wastsoever (other than normal city sounds in the middle of the night). Hotel staff was great - very polite and were truly there to help. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone - it is incredible located.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, too few amenities”
Reviews.Author: lucky1adrastus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Oriente for in one of the front rooms. The price was extremely steep, more than twice what we payed for a larger room with kitchen in Salamanca, and even 20 euros more than the larger room we booked in Central Madrid. The air conditioner barely worked. After a shower, the room was a sauna for hours. They charge extra for everything. Breakfast was an absured 15 euro per person buffet. Internet is 10 euros extra a night! (It was free in all our other hotels in Spain). Laundry is simply extortionate. We couldn't find a local lavanderia which was open in August, so we had the hotel do one load of landry. It would have cost us $1.75 in the US to do oursevles (or 7 euros at the drop-off laundry we found in Madrid). They charged us 108 euros. A markup of well over a 1000%! The front desk staff mostly speak English and are polite, but surprisingly unknowledgable and lacking in initiaitive. More often than not, I saw a guest asking questioins about the city, only to get a blank response, and then another guest would give them advice. Oh, and a note for honeymooners. The best rooms all have twin beds, not doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect help in case of emergency”
Reviews.Author: HollyG1
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say I can, in no way, recommend this hotel. My boyfriend and I had been very much looking forward to a trip to Barcelona and the Husa Oriente looked like a reasonably comfortable, suitably located place to stay. Unfortunately, within 3 hours of arriving in the city, I'd been attacked and robbed by two men on a motorbike. I'd read the safety advice regarding the city and had taken precautions. Nonetheless, the incident happened and the fact that an attack like this could happen at 4pm in the centre of the city was a shock - I've lived and travelled across Europe for years and have never experienced anything like it. Somehow we made our way back to the hotel, to find out about the location of the hospital and the police station. We also needed to find out contact details for my mobile phone company, so my phone could be blocked from use by the thieves. Unfortunately, the staff on duty at the desk were entirely unhelpful and uncaring and we received no aid. As a result, there was a considerable delay (hours) in being able to get treatment , report the incident to the police and to have my mobile phone blocked by the mobile company. I was in a great deal of pain - my arm had to be strapped up and I am unable to return to work before September. We were both in a state of shock. In spite of all this, while the incident took place at 4pm, we were unable to stop and try to recover until after midnight. The following morning, we checked out. Different staff were on duty at reception. The young man at reception my boyfriend spoke to clearly knew about the incident the previous day. He said how sorry he was, said to let him know if there was anything he could do to help. The charge for the few minutes I had needed to phone the Card Protection company, which I was able to do by 11pm the previous evening, was waived. If this had been the approach of the staff on duty the previous day, at the point of emergency, when help was desperately needed, this could have been a very different review indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around ...”
Reviews.Author: SurreyTraveller58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Oriente several years back (before it was a Husa, I think) so decided to have a bit of an "homage" on this weekend trip in July. Bang in the middle of everything, so full marks for location ... easy access to most things and plenty of eating choices on the Ramblas. Beware though - restaurants on the Ramblas can be very pricey ... two course dinner (not that great a dinner either) with half a bottle of red wine was €74 - that's about GBP60. Ouch! Our room was modern, fresh and clean. It was very quiet as it faced the rear of the property, so no Ramblas rabble to keep you awake at night. The down side of course, is no wonderful view ... we looked out at a brick wall. Hey ho .... Overall I'd recommend The Orient, but avoid the overpriced buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect- would go back”
Reviews.Author: CarrinaCornwall
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in May, went to Barcelona for a short weekend and the Hotel was great for what we wanted. Bang in the middle of everything! We didn't find the rooms too noisy and ours directly looked over Ramlas. (Could be due to the fact we were tired from site-seeing and ahd a few vinos!) Rooms were clean and light. Staff were pleasant. Breakfast I felt could have been better though. Over the road from the hotel there's a little street that opens up onto the a huge square, make sure you check that out and restaurants there are good too. Also recommend the indoor market just a few blocks away, great for grabbing fresh fruit for lunch. Would def go back x

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona24
Reviews.Content: The location at the Husa was great. 10min walk to the port. The staff spoke English and was friendly. We had a triple room the fit three people well. Of course if three women are traveling together with 1 bathroom that might be a challenge. Our room had a balcony facing Ramblas. It is definitely loud but not to the point where I could not sleep. I traveled with my girlfriend who is a light sleeper and she managed just fine. If you are a light sleeper you might consider ear plugs. The only compliant I had with hotel was the A/C broke the first night we were there. It never really worked again during our stay (1 week) and our room was hot. If you are the type of traveler who spends the majority of there stay in the hotel meaning you don’t like to venture out, I would suggest another place. If you view a hotel room as a place to lay your head and shower then this place is perfect. It is very clean. As a side note – Ramblas is a tourist trap….everything is way over priced. Head off Ramblas towards the Cathedral of Barcelona and you will find much better food that is less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy”
Reviews.Author: alexa1973
Reviews.Content: Good location but extremely noisy. Be ready not to sleep at all, because it’s situation in the middle of the Barcelona busiest street with non-stop celebration. Clean dining room. Rooms themselves are small and basics. No fridge. No English speaking TV. Don’t forget your own shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: shellbelle21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a three night stay at the Oriente in Barcelona, and thought for a three star hotel, the hotel was perfect. Rooms were basic, but clean and laundry changed by the maids daily.
