We stayed in a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the Ramblas, and although there was noise, we were so shattered from all the walking and sightseeing we did, it didn't make any difference, and was nice to look out and do a bit of people watching! Girls - just to let you know, there is only one mirror which is in the bathroom....if you're anything like me, that's really annoying when there's two of you trying to get ready!! Would def recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Hairy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Room on the front overlooking ramblas - noisy as anything - no sleep - no double glazing - very bad. Average hotel at best Ramblas was hideous - full of tourists and cheap mime acts Barcelona was one huge disappointment - no buzz no nightlife - I'd rather go to Bognor than Barca - its overhyped and abysmal.

Reviews.Title: “Triple Room, March 2008”
Reviews.Author: London018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in a triple room in March 2008. We booked through lastminute.com This hotel in on La Rambla and whilst I read other reviews that made note of the noise from the street, we didn't find it to be a problem at all. If anything any noise that we heard was internal as the hallways are all marble and sound echoed if people were talking loudly. The room was quite spacious and left plenty of room for us to move about with three beds and all our luggage. It was very clean and decorated modernly. The bathroom included a bath which was a nice change and quite relaxing after a long day walking around. The location on La Rambla was good as it was close to entertainment and sights. If you head down towards Columbus' Tower (towards the water) you can catch the hop-on hop-off bus which will take you all around Barcelona. Heading in the opposite direction (away from the water) for about 5 - 10 minutes on the same side of the street is a fresh produce market tucked away. It is massive and stocks a variety of foods. We brough fruit there for breakfast buying pineapple, a kilo of strawberries, and coconut for around 5 euro. This hotel is right in the middle of everything with buskers, shops, restaurants, markets all within easy wlaking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bmoe
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It can be noisy at night but it is right on the Ramblas a great spot for sightseing. - take some ear plugs just in case. We had two triple and one double room. All very clean. Beds very comfortable. Friendly reception staff. Breakfast was very nice. Don't miss the dancing fountains in Espana square. They are simple fountains during the day, but around 7 pm music plays all around the square and the water starts 'dancing' creating colours and emotions.The show is only on fridays and saturdays 7 pm to 9 pm.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lcsn18
Reviews.Content: as a travel agent, i am able to look at various different sources for accommodation and after in depth research i decided on this one for me and my family. ROOMS i booked a double and a triple. the rooms were fantastic with a very modern and minimalistic feel to them, both were very spacious and had a small typical balcony over looking the ramblas. a few people have complained about the noise but what do you expect staying in the very centre of the main street of a very big city!!! LOCATION the hotel is fantastic as it is right in the middle of the ramblas and virtually everything is within walking distance. there are your typical tapas bars but a mix of everything else, italian, seafood, fast food and much more. it is worth paying that little bit more and staying at this hotel. a tip for getting to the attractions a bit further out is to go to the end of the ramblas by the port and go to the information desk to buy a bus touristic pass. its 20euros for one day and 26 euros for two days. its a open roof double decker bus and it has 3 routes which you can get on and off at all day. it takes you to places such as sagrada familia and Barcelonas football stadium Camp Nou. along with the pass you get a map, discount booklet and some headphones which you plug into your seat on the bus and it tells you what your looking at as you go round the city. i loved the city and the whole atmosphere and will 100% be returning. any questions just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice! but take ear plugs :-)”
Reviews.Author: dillon71
Reviews.Content: NB we stayed here in the winter and the hotel was at 30 % occupancy We booked this hotel as part of a package deal - the agent warned us that it was basic (3 star) but in a GREAT location. Which is true - the location is perfect - on Ramblas, opposite the Gothic qtr. not far from the sea... The room was new and very clean but very basic - no fancy extras. In the bathroom there was a powerful walk-in shower but not many toiletries; just sachet shampoo/body wash and hand soap - so remember to take with you what you need. Our room didn't have a working room safe - so remember to check yours if this is important to you. We moved to another room and the safe worked fine. The receptionist let me see several double rooms and they were of varying sizes - one of the double rooms I saw was tiny (barely room to squeeze around the bed) - another was huge (plenty of floor room). So if your room seems small - note that bigger rooms do exist in the same price range. Things that make this a good hotel and not a perfect one: Slight drain smell (but it dispersed quickly after closing the bathroom door and opening the window) Broken safe in first room You need ear plugs if your room is street side No shower cap / toiletries in the bathroom Small thin towels No extra pillows in the room (but I asked hose-keeping and got extra - might not be possible to do this high season) but don't forget: cheap, clean, newly re-furnished, historic building, friendly staff, GREAT location Have a wonderful time! Barcelona is a superb city and we had such fun visiting the museums, tapas bars, seafood restaurants, the markets, seeing art by Picasso, Gaudi, Miro, Gothic Art - and great shopping too! (Insider tip - for an in-depth invaluable Barcelona guide that I found via another tripadvisor's advice - internet search - maribel's guides ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -Very noisey.”
Reviews.Author: Gillo
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned having stayed at the Oriente 24/2/08- 27/02.08. We found the hotel to be in a perfect location, you can walk everywhere. Room was big and spotless. We had breakfast at the hotel cost 14 euros found it to be very substancial . Now the down side sorry. Please ask for a room at the back we had a side room found it to be very loud in the nights woken up often by people shouting outside on La Ramblas. We never have trouble sleeping ,this time we did. When we booked we thought they had a lounge that you could enjoy a drink of an evening it was closed bar man on holiday so if you want a bar go else where. I don't think we would revisit this hotel due to the noise factor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyPhillips05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. We had a fantastic time. The hotel was very grand looking, the rooms very clean. Bathroom was good size and also clean. Staff very friendly. Would definately recommend this hotel to friends and would return to this hotel if we visit Barcelona again. The hotel itself is approx 10 minute walk down la rambla. Lots of good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Guido62
Reviews.Content: Stopped at The Husa Oriente 11/01/08-13/01/08 for a nice weekend break. This hotel is in the perfect place for access to the RAMBLAS & surrounding area. The rooms are very clean & functional. The Breakfast was all fresh & enough to get some calories on board for a good day out...would certainly recommend staying here again...but get a room at the rear of the hotel as the Ramblas can be noisey...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Wild North East of England
Reviews.Title: “Central, adequate, spotlessly clean.”
Reviews.Author: J-Jo-Designs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oriente over Christmas with my Dad and my son in a triple room. The room & en-suite were both enormous and spotlessly clean, but had very basic furniture - 2 single beds with double headboard, a double sofa bed, small single cabinet with TV, a chair & stool, fitted wardrobe. There was only a lace curtain with rubber blackout curtain behind it. No dressing table or tea/coffee facilities. Our room faced the street at the side and had double glazed sliding doors to the balcony, which helped with the inevitable noise. PS - the walls are VERY thin! Breakfast was in a beautiful newly decorated room and was abundant, although real fresh orange juice would be nice. There is no bar or restaurant within the hotel, and the lounge facilities are just a few chairs in the reception area. The staff were very friendly and helpful with info, taxi-booking etc. Although the hotel is very central to la Rambla and is next door to the opera house, its also getting towards the seedy end of the street - the top end close to Placa de Catalunya being much better. We had a fab hol and very good hotel deal with www.hotelsclick.com., would not stay there again though!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here and still great!”
Reviews.Author: charliechops99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years a go when I came to Barcelona with a group of my girlfriends and thought the hotel was great then. Been to Barcelona five times now and have stayed in apartments the other times but thought I would give the Oriente another try. It didn't dissapoint! The hotel has been recently refurbished and is alot more modern than before, but it has still retained its charm. The reception staff were very cheery, polite and helpful and we all had a giggle with them when we checked in! We had booked 3 rooms as 6 of us were travelling. Two couples wanted rooms overlooking the Ramblas and one couple wanted a quiet room at the back and they immediately accommodated us - it was no problem at all. The ramblas rooms were the refurbished rooms and the back room was in the older style of room, but still very nice and much bigger than the Ramblas rooms! We were all very happy with our rooms (albeit the Ramblas rooms were very small) and found them to be very comfortable and clean. The bathrooms are a bit sparce and clinical, but hey! you only wash, shower etc in them anyway! We had a safe, hairdryer, TV and controllable heating in all the rooms. The Ramblas rooms are noisy but to us it adds to the atmosphere of being in such a great location in such a great city! The room at the back was indeed quiet, so if you are a light sleeper book one of those! Breakfast was fine - everything available, not gourmet but perfectly acceptable! All in all this is great hotel in a fabulous location and it is very good value for money. I personally am very glad I stayed there again and my family all really liked it too - we are planning another trip next year and will certainly look to stay at the Oriente again! Here are some good places to eat and fun bars to go to - BILBAO BERRIA - Great tapas restaurant in the square by the cathedral. Yum! LA GAVINA RESTAURANT - Wonderful food infact it was fabulous! Not cheap but worth every penny. In Palau del Mar, Port Vell. CAL PINXO - Next to La Gavina and just as good! IRATI - Another tapas restaurant off of Las Ramblas down a side street that I cant remember - tasty! BOSC DE LES FADES - Really fun, fairytale bar! Well worth a visit just for the experience! Turn right by the Wax Musuem. OLYMPIC PORT - Good night out if you are in a lively mood! Loads of bars, clubs and restaurants. Some of the restaurants are not too good so beware! One good one here is REY DE LA GAMBA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaidstoneHelena
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 2 nights here and we both thought it was a great hotel. The situation was perfect - about 6 mins from the harbour, very close to the Gothic Quarter, in the centre of the bustling city and close by for the open top bus tours. We had a twin room on the second floor and it was very spacious, a lovely shower and was spotless. It was cleaned on our full day there. The staff were a great help and spoke excellent English. They provided us with a map and pointed out the best places to stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: HeyLTD
Reviews.Content: We visited as part of a bicycling group of 22. Fantastic location in the middle of the Ramblas, clean rooms, great breakfast, very helpful staff. Ask for a room that does not overlook the Ramblas if you are a light sleeper - the party goes on all night out there!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Oriente”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler_TV
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple and we stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The staff was very kind. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. At our last night we were given the choice to stay in the junior suit and we were the first to use it (it was brand new) and we loved it! And of course, the location is ideal. We will visit there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: SaharahF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my sister for four nights in September.All the staff where extremely helpful and couldn't have been nicer.Our room was massive and situated on the first floor. The balcony looked out on to La Rambla which was great for watching the colourful mix of people passing by. It was quite noisey in the early hours of the morning but the double glazed doors do work a treat. However if you are a very light sleeper then I would ask the staff for a room at the back or side of the hotel. The room had been recently renovated and was very modern and chic.The bathroom was a great size and the whole place was immaculately clean. The breakfast room in the mornings was always very busy but a wide range or hot and cold food is avaliable until 11am. The location is perfect for first time visitors to the city as all amenities and tourist information is at your doorstep. Don't be afraid to explore though. La Rambla like most major city centers can be very over priced for even simple things like bottled water. The pavement cafes and resturants are more expensive here than in most places in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, low cost & in the middle of it all !”
Reviews.Author: emmakersey
Reviews.Content: Popped to Barcelona for 3 days during our summer hols. Thought this hotel was great. Fab location, right on La Rambla, easy access for open top bus, metro etc. The hotel was spotless, rooms of a very good standard for the price, breakfast was great too (several helpings!) The stafff could not have been more accomodating and friendly and spoke very good English too! To save a few Euros, drink in the bar area, it is about 20% cheaper than the seats on La Rambla. When you fed up of listening to the hub-ub going into the night, shut the windows and put the a/c on! Loved it, would go again.

Reviews.Title: “very central, very clean”
Reviews.Author: donnyroo
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in this hotel, 20 mins in a taxi from airport. It is in the main street of Las Ramblas surrounded by entertainment.. cannot beat the location. its noisy on a night time .. but i would definately recommend it. Very clean, Very private, no hassle .. an overall excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Merly21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Husa Oriente from 13-16.7.07 with my two friends. We had a triple room which was very spacious with a huge bathroom. Both the bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean. We hadn't booked breakfast so cant comment on the food. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we were able to leave our cases at the hotel until we returned to collect them en route to the airport. The location was great - right on La Rambla so convenient for everything. However - and this was the only downside - the noise in the night from outside was terrible - mostly drunken, noisy folks roaming about which went on til the very early hours, so I would recommend earplugs! Our room was at the rear so I dont know how noisy it would have been at the front! Very enjoyable overall and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Does in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: thebestforless
Reviews.Content: Right on Las Ramblas, this hotel is conveniently located. If you value quiet, ask for an old room at the back, if you prefer style, ask for a modern room overlooking Las Ramblas. Be forewarned, the revelry continues through the wee hours. If you want both, stay off Las Ramblas. The staff was extremely accommodating, except for one desk clerk that we referred to as "the burro." The rooms were clean and the location was pretty good. We were able to walk to Sagrada Familia as well as the Marina. The primary attraction is that they were able to accommodate a family of four in a quad. The room offerred two twin beds and a pull-out sofa. That having been said, we will stay at another location next time, just to experience another part of the city. The sights, sounds and tastes of Barcelona are wonderful! I encourage you to taste a authentic paella, gazapcho and sangria. Tour La Sagrada Familia (awe inspiring), the Picasso Museum, the Aquarium (for kids), and the gothic center. Viva Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “No problems, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Markthemover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with 2 friends. We had a triple room, consisting of two singles and a sofa bed. This wasnt a problem for us as we were only there for the weekend. The room was large, with ample space and was clean. as was the bathroom. Free safe too! The room was serviced each day which i cant say about a lot of hotels in europe! Our room was located on the 4th floor facing out onto the ramblas, If you intednt to spend a lot of time in the room or have early nights then this may not be the best location for you as the noise was fairly bad and was evident all through the night. But if you want to be in the centre of everything then it doesnt get much better. Never had any problems, with staff or lifts etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dina808
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us for the location and the cleaniness. It was very clean and the location great, but for the price, it wasn't worth the money. Staff was friendly, but not too accommodating. The hotel is still going through renovations on the outside, so you do hear some work going on. It wasn't too bad for us though, because we were there on the weekend and during the feast of St.Jordi. Our room was not situated along the Ramblas, so we didn't hear too much pedestrian noise. The only thing that really bothered me about this hotel was that the shower was small and there was nowhere to put your soap, shampoo, etc.. Also, the screen that closes off the shower does not prevent water from soaking up the bathroom floor. Yes, they do have a hairdryer and it also has a room safe, unlike what others have said previously. The free breakfast buffet was good and plentiful. If I'm ever in Barcelona again, I would defitnitely look into another hotel, if only to experience something different. If you are not going to be spending all of your time in your room, then this is all you'll need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Jimbob72
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last reviewer - and not with the majority of others. The hotel is absolutely fine as a 3*. Clean, well designed rooms (albeit a bit small - but not surprising for the location), comfortable beds, hot shower, stylish furniture and brilliant location. Don't worry about the noise from La Rambla as the double glazing is very effective. Very helpful reception staff who all spoke English to a certain degree and a restaurant and bar in-house. Would not hesitate to stay here again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Had no problems with this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Joanne⪼ott
Reviews.Content: When I first booked this hotel I was dreading arriving after reading the previous results. I don't know where these people were staying who said it was basic, the t.v. didn't work, the shower was broke. People made it sound like a run down hotel. I had no problems whatsoever. The rooms were clean, had plenty of storage, the t.v. and shower worked. The towels were changed each day and your bed was made. The room was a standard hotel room, if you want more than a 3* then pay for a 5*. The location was great, in the heart of everything. If you wish to stay on the main street there is bound to be some degree of noise, but in my opinion it was not an issue. All the employees spoke English, were helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel (it has beds), Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Desiato53
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 family rooms (each with 4 beds) on Expedia for 2 nights. When we got to the hotel, they downgraded one of the rooms to 2 beds even though we had paid the supplement on Expedia. We wanted two large rooms as we were travelling with my parents and we wanted to have flexibility as to where the kids were going to sleep. The service at reception was minimal, and when we got out of the lift we were presented with a building site with thick dust in the air and cardboard on the floors. The one family room we did get was in a great place on the front of the building with two balconies overlooking the Ramblas. My parents got a tiny room at the back of the building. The pictures on Expedia are much grander than the real thing. This hotel is nothing more than a basic hotel and I don't know how it gets it 3 star rating. The breakfast room is not big enough when the hotel is busy and we found that we had to hang around to find a spare table. On both days we had to squat at a dirty one until someone came and cleared it. On the second day there was a shortage of staff (and food) and the manager seemed to be more worried about replacing the broken light bulbs (when the restaurant was bursting full) rather than feeding the guests. When I asked for the key to the minibar at reception, I got told I couldn't have it because of the Expedia rate I was on. I didn't understand the logic here as I've yet to come across a minibar that is all inclusive - so we went out and bought some water instead! The hotel is in a good location but that is about it. Would not stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lammejn
Reviews.Content: What I'd read about booking rooms in Barcelona far in advance was right.. We booked a room at this hotel because it was one of the few available in the city due to our late booking - 3 weeks before we were to go. In comparison to others we saw, $200 for the night here was not a good value. The room itself was below average in furnishings and lighting but the real problem was the reception desk staff. One example was our difficulty with operating the electric monitor in our room. We've traveled extensively in Europe but had never encountered one of these things that requires your room key to turn the lights on AND keep them on. Even with my husband's fairly good Spanish, they couldn't seem to understand that we didn't know how to turn on the lights in our room - I can't believe we were the first guests to have a question about them. It finally took another guest we met in the elevator to show us what to do. That being said, the breakfast buffet was very good and would be good for groups traveling together.

Reviews.Title: “Check your room first”
Reviews.Author: Fabricio
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on internet hoping we would get the room. Hoping, because we first phoned and had been told that there were no rooms free. But on the internet we managed to get one. We made a reservation for the best room so the most expensive one. When we got there the receptionest (he could be more client-friendly) gave us a room you couldnot even turn your back and which was much less than we expected. We went back to the receptionist but he said that there was no other room available. We wouldnot accept that and after some arguement he suddenly find us another room. This was bigger and more what we expected but not really. Ther was no telphone, TV broken, no seats and table no hairdryer and nothing to put your toiletthings on. We didnot want to argue anymore because the receptionist was not so polite and overall the location is great. The ballroom is in renovation so you will see nothing of the beaty of the hotel...the price is the same. Execpt af one receptionist and the hotelmanager all the other employees were very polite and nice. It is a clean hotel without the eye for detailles, a staff that need a better manager and first-receptionist and the rates are too high. It is a hotel with a 2 star service and 4 star prices. The location really is great but there are way enough other hotels in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “What A Shame!”
Reviews.Author: MBidel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona. We went with friends and there were 2 couples travelling. The hotel was booked directly in August - confirmed and all hotel required information given including credit card info etc. Having started our trip at 4am and finally arriving at the hotel at 11.30am we were looking forward to checking in, freshening up and finally seeing what Barcelona had to offer. Unfortunately the hotel had other ideas, they had cancelled our booking with no notification and given our rooms instead to other guests who had paid before arrival. It took 2 hours for them to book another hotel (not on the Ramblas - but 15 minutes from the centre - try 25!) and the receptionist's attitude of I've done you a favour by booking another hotel, didn't help! Becareful if you book direct and keep all your confirmation documents with you (not that it helped us!) He booked us into a sister hotel which was very nice but because of my husband's knee injury was unsuitable due to its location. Barcelona was fantastic - we'd go again - and even though Hotel Oriente is well placed I'd book another Ramblas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Husa Oriente!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nubiangyrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Las Ramblas in the heart of Barcelona, Spain. For women traveling alone or in groups, beware! The location is not the best for female travelers. The hotel did not live up to it's three-star rating. Let's put it this way...my traveling companions and I moved the dresser in front of the door to block it. It was the only way of giving us the slightest bit of security. If the pistachio colored walls patched with duct tape isn't warning enough for you, let me share that one of my traveling companions is now battling with a case of bed bugs most likely picked up at this hotel. Do your homework before selecting any hotel on Las Ramblas and I definitely would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: fordmunch
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Husa Oriente. We booked at the last minute through Expedia so weren't sure what we were getting. We were pleasently surprised by the size and cleanliness of the rooms. The bathroom was particularly good with great bath towels and a very large bath. Hotel is right on Ramblas so of course there is some noise but you expect that with the great location. Cost was part of a package with Expedia so not sure on the break down but estimate it to be around $150 Aus per night which was the best value for money we had all holiday. Would recommend to young people travelling to Barcelona as is on main street and within walking distance to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Unmet expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on this hotel because of all the good reviews we read about it and the prime location. When we checked into the room, we realized it was not what we read about at all. We had paid over $250 a night only to find that the room was small and looks unfinished because of the plastering on the ceiling. Telephone was not working. TV was not working. Hot water was inconsistent when showering. There was no hair dryer. I should also mention that we were shocked when someone unlocked and walked into our room. We later learned that the receptionist had made a mistake and assigned the same room twice. That perhaps was an honest mistake on the part of the receptionist and we can accept that. However, when we reported the problems to the front desk, the receptionist was very rude. He was not apologetic at all for all the inconveniences. The gentleman who came to look at the TV and eventually changed the TV, however, was very courteous and helpful. He helped us call the taxi and carry the luggage out on our last day there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Location (very friendly Staff)”
Reviews.Author: Surfingh2o
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night (24/06/06). The room was at the rear of the hotel so we didn't experience any noise (didn't have a great view though). The key feature of the hotel, "the Ballroom" where we thought we would have breakfast was a building site. However, we had breakfast in the other ballroom which was nice. The breakfast is great. Ever though I moaned a bit. The room was large, clean and tidy. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. A nice friendly hotel in an amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lindy_M_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orient in November 2005 with my husband, it was in an excellent location on the Ramblas. We stayed for a long weekend, didn't have any problems with noise, even though we were overlooking the Ramblas and had a balcony. The hotel was undergoing refurbishment to the rooms at the time and, while our room had not been refurbished, it was extremely clean and the maid visited daily. The breakfast was excellent and it was in an absolutely beautiful balcony room overlooking what was once the ballroom and gave you a taste of the hotel in its glory days! The staff were very helpful and pleasant and booked us a taxi for when we left and stood at the door to await its arrival then carried our bags out for us. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, would definitely reccommend it and would certainly return. One word of warning.......DO NOT go to the chinese restaurant next door to the Oriente, it could seriously damage your health and spoil your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “At the Heart of it”
Reviews.Author: Alysoneva
Reviews.Content: Stayed there to celebrate 20th Wedding anniversary. We had to change rooms as first room sprung a leak in air con on first day. Staff helpful. Both rooms clean and looked out onto Las Ramblas. Corner room was large and comfortable but no socket for hairdryer near a mirror as I recall. Las Ramblas quite lively even through the night but that just seemed to add to its fascination. We did not have any meals at Hotel but did use the bar area outside in the late evening to watch the world go by. Down side that the bar would not serve us with coffee at night. It was a good location easy to walk to sea front, Place de Catalunya etc. Easy to pick up tourist buses in Place de Catalnuya and airport bus. All in all we loved Barcelona and hotel was a positve experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Iwan-Machen
Reviews.Content: Written about in some books as being at the seedy end of the Ramblas, I'm not really surprised as some doubtful characters did abound in the off streets nearby in the gathering darkness. My wife nearly got done in the Casca Antic in broad daylight, with a sizeable squirt of tomato ketchup on her back in order to make her open or even put down her handbag - to look for tissues or the like, while being circled by a gang of young men moving like wolves!! However, it was nice to get back to the safety of the hotel with its approachable and supportive staff who had no hesitation in advising and helping us. Initially, we did have a "matrimonial bed" in a rather small but silent room, but as we seemed to trip over everything, we asked to be moved to a bigger room, which indeed, did overlook a particularly busy and noisy area with the police vehicle depot next door. No need to ask whether or not they came to life at night. We got used to it, however, and even slept well at times in the four nights spent there in plenty of warmth. A decent multiaspect plentiful continental breakfast could be varied on a daily basis, although the lack of human involvement did seem to give the Comedor a bit of a cold atmosphere. If I wanted to nitpick, I have no doubt that I could moan about a few things, such as no room telephone- I had my mobile: one had to hire a hair drier- deposit returnable: TV was all Spanish- then we're in that country:( I did see Barca and Real Madrid playing, however!! But it was clean, warm, comfortable and convenient!!! And ONLY Three Star

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms, friendly service, affordable prices, within walking distance of the market, cathederal,port and much more.

Reviews.Title: “So Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: missfifi42
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, clean, spacious, modern. Really excellent. However, we had asked for a quiet room. The friendly concierge said he would put us on the quiet side of the building. We had checked in at about 2 am (another good thing: 24 hour desk). At about 9 am I woke up to the delightful sounds of heavy construction. Quite confused, I looked out the window to see 10 or 20 workers on scaffolding about 10 meters from our room. Quiet side of the building? When we called the front desk to complain, they said "that is the quiet side of the building", not meaning to say that it was, in fact, the "quieter" side of the building, but meaning that we were liars and we must be confused as to what the word "quiet" means. Very strange. Horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Two twenty something girls in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: LondonUKDee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a visit to Barcelona for New Years ( Dec 31st - Jan 4th). Husa Oriente is an attractive hotel in the most convenient setting, we got a cheap deal through Expedia. Our room was huge! Although a bit sparse it was vey modern and extremely clean, plenty of wardrobe space and a large bathroom with a powerful shower and large bath. Overlooking Las Ramblas is the only way to stay here - who needs the TV? Staff are polite and happy to advise, order taxis, provide directions & recommendations.The restaurant is a bit tucked away on the 1st floor but not needed here. Breakfast on Las Ramblas is good at Cafe L'Opera and Mercat de la Boqueria (to the left of the hotel. But venture further out for better quality/cheaper prices for lunch/dinner (The Lonely Planet guide is invaluable for reccommendations, metro map etc). El Born is trendy, with great boutiques, bars and restaurants, also old town architecture & Piccasso Museum - make a day of it! Placa Real opposite the hotel is great for bars & clubs if (like us) you're into Jazz, soul, funk, hip hop rnb etc. Jamboree is a live venue (excellent bands) followed by a club night packed out with all nationalities - we met Australians, Italians, Germans and Americans as well as Catalonians . Don't think of clubbing before 1am though! Can you take the pace?! There's also a very wonderful french restaurant to the left (white interior - can't remember the name!) Amazing food, a la carte style but very reasonable! If you like chocolate they do this amazing cake with hot melted chocolate inside. Gorgeous! Undesirables may try to sell you beer, roses and possibly drugs but just walk away it's not that scary - just keep your bag strapped across you and walk with purpose! Las Ramblas was electric on New Years eve! We ventured out following the crowds towards Placa Catalunya at the top of Las Ramblas where the crowds gathered in there thousands it seemed! (In the day this area is the high street shopping centre but Mango, Top Shop, Miss Selfridge etc have nothing on the UK versions - very sparse!) Jump on the Metro to Passeig de Gracia for big posh boutiques then one stop to Urquinaona for Factory Outlets. Then Jaume I (El Born) for funky boutiques & drink/ dinner. Do not miss Gaudi's Sagrada Familia - we were awestruck!!

Reviews.Title: “Would return if remained value for money”
Reviews.Author: LouMG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a three night citybreak after Christmas at the Husa Oriente. Due to the deal we found it was good value for money but I would not wish to pay Four Star prices for what I consider a good Three Star hotel. The good points; - Fantastic central location - Great standing on balcony watching world go by - Lots of places nearby for tea, coffee and breakfast, along with dinner/drinking so not need to use hotel restaurant - Spotlessly clean rooms, all recently refurbished - Polite, helpful desk staff - One of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in The not so good points; - Furniture spare in rooms- would have appreciated luggage rack and full length mirror - Yes, earplugs are recommended for light sleepers as rambla busy 24/7 - Although 20 odd TV channels none in English; not even CNN or BBC World - although reception staff said all rooms were now renovated (after following advice from tripadvisor and asking for renovated room)we were awoken at 8.30am by very loud drilling for an hour outside our room Would recommend; -Cafe l'Opera for breakfast and tapas -Santa Monica restaurant in beautiful square opposite for supper- 21 Euros for three courses, good food and wine - Tourist bus- 2 day ticket value for money - Starbucks for coffee when walking down ramblas from airport bus after what was a very early start from home - wax work museum worth a peruse- very funny- especially Charles and Camilla!

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location but that's about all that's good. EXTREMELY noise 24/7 - had to get ear plugs. Some staff unfriendly, others okay. Check out whether your room rate includes breakfast. If it doesn't, avoid it - it's way over priced at 12 euros per day/per person - even if you get just coffee. There are no signs or staff in the dining room to advise you and the desk staff didn't bring it up - so don't assume - otherwise it's a big hit on your bill. A complaint brought no satisfaction. We won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “husa oriente”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the above hotel and although it was very central, I was a little dissapointed. We paid almost £100 a night for a very basic room and no breakfast. The bar was closed on Sunday and Monday and the restaurant is closed in the winter months. I would not rush to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Get booking now”
Reviews.Author: TBeckett100
Reviews.Content: Apologies for my slightly biased review, but the incredible 65euro a night deal for a room from laterooms was the bargain of a century. The hotel room we had was fantastic. It proves cheap rates don't give you the worst room. When booking drop them an email and ask them for a 1st floor room overlooking Las Ramblas. The rooms are newly decorated and furnished to a high standard. I would have paid twice what I did for that room. The staff were friendly, they offer breakfast at 12 euro each, which we missed in favour of the restauants at the top of Las Ramblas, where bacon eggs toast and coffee will set you back a whopping 5.5 euros. Ching Ching. The hotel is great, get there on an early flight and ensure the best rooms! The hotel is located 2/3rd's of the way down Las Ramblas on the right, walking distance to Barri Gothic, Port Vell, Placa Catalunya. Some tips now for you eager barcelona travellers to ensure a good stay. a) Get the AI bus from the airport. Far cheaper then a taxi, runs every 10 mins and stops at the top of Las Ramblas. Air conditioned. 1) Las Ramblas is home to may entertainment artists. Make sure you keep your valuables out of reach when soaking up the atmosphere. Any city will have pickpockets, don't get distracted. 2) Las Ramblas is also home to a spot of con trickery in the form of cup and ball games. Min stake is 50 Euro and you are guaranteed to lose. Dont get tempted. The crowd must be in on the con, either that or they have been betting for the past 8 visits to Barcelona. Dont get sucked in! 3) I had a pleasent pizza/pasta dish at the Pizza (express) place on the top of las ramblas. There are some cracking little places to eat. For the budget conscious, steer away from the ramblas pavement cafes. There are plenty of asian people showing you an empty table, but a drink can cost a whopper, so be careful and check prices. Much cheaper prices can be found in the side streets. 4) Next to the hotel is a restaurant that serves fantastic tapas and Paella. You will easily spot the restaurant for the amount of hanging hams on the ceiling. Worth a visit. 4) Plaza Real, just be careful of men selling beer cans and shady types on the fountain in the middle. They sell drugs and its not an ideal place to get your wallet out!! 5) Fancy a day at the beach? Just outside the hotel on the left up las ramblas is the Metro. Sitges is a wonderful town where they have a great sandy beach, lovely shops and good eateries. Just take the green L3 metro line from liceu to Sants Estacio, then at the other end head towards the main railway station, to catch a connecting 30 min train ride to Sitges (look for Via 5 or 6 to St Vincec as it can be daunting initially!) Well worth a few quid for a great day out of the city! 6) Poble Espanol is not my favourite place, the taxi there can be as much as 10 Euros, the entry is 7.5 euros each. I dont like paying to shop!! The shops were mainly closed when we went, but if you like a bit of architecture, then by all means go, but dont kick your self if you miss going. Get a taxi from Espana metro stop. Its a 2 min ride and should not cost much. Finally if you get a room overlooking the Ramblas, pop acrosss in the evening to the Italian ice cream shop and bring it back with you. Its a great way to people watch from your room. Finally, Barcelona is a great place - you will enjoy it, but remember to keep your wallet and valuables hidden for that unspoilt trip. Adios.

Reviews.Title: “don't belive all you read !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from barcelona,we stayed at the husa oriente.after reading some really bad reviews.i would like to give it the thumbs up.very clean very helpfull,and excellent value for money.we saw no bad things go on what so ever.right next door to the hotel is a lovely restaurant with good staff and a friendly atmosphere.if you go down towards the water there is a lovely boat were you can have a glass of cava and some nice tapas.i really enjoyed myself.all the gaudi is out of this world.i would recommend the bus tour the orange bus it takes you all round barecelona and you can hop on and off all day.cost 18 euros well worth it,you can pick it up at the la ramblas,by the hard rock cafe.so go on and enjoy, your love it!

HotelInfo.Name: Husa Oriente
HotelInfo.Address: Ramblas, 45, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
